Hopping into Quarto with froggeR

froggeR.Rmd

Welcome to the Lily Pad! üê∏

Hey there! I‚Äôm Teek, and I‚Äôll be your amphibian guide to creating awesome Quarto projects. Let‚Äôs hop right in!

Why Use froggeR?

Ever felt like project setup was taking longer than the actual analysis? Been there! That‚Äôs why we created froggeR - to help you leap over those pesky setup hurdles and get straight to the good stuff.

Quick Start

Let‚Äôs create a new Quarto project with all the ribbit-ing features you need:

library(froggeR)

# Create a new project with default settings
quarto_project("my_analysis")

Boom! üéâ Just like that, you‚Äôve got: - A structured Quarto document - Custom SCSS styling - Git ignore settings - README template - And more!

What‚Äôs in Your New Pad?

When you create a project with froggeR, here‚Äôs what you get (no flies included):

  1. Quarto Document (my_analysis.qmd):
    • Pre-configured YAML header
    • Clean, professional styling
    • Ready for your brilliant analysis!
  2. Style Sheet (custom.scss):
    • Make your documents look crisp
    • Easy to customize
    • No CSS expertise required
  3. Project Config (.Rproj):
    • Consistent project settings
    • Works smoothly with RStudio
    • No more ‚Äúbut it works on my machine‚Äù!
  4. Git Ready (.gitignore):
    • Smart defaults for R projects
    • Keeps your repository clean
    • No accidental file commits

Customizing Your Pad

Want to make it your own? No problem! Here‚Äôs how to customize different aspects:

Custom YAML Variables 

# Create or modify _variables.yml
write_variables()  # Interactive prompts for your info

Custom Styling 

# Add your own SCSS styles
write_scss(name = "my_styles")

Advanced Hopping

Ready to take your Quarto game to the next level? Here are some pro tips:

  1. Multiple Documents:
# Create additional Quarto docs in your project
write_quarto(
  filename = "analysis_part2",
  path = "my_analysis"
)
  1. Template Reuse:
# Use your custom setup across projects
quarto_project(
  "new_project",
  default = TRUE  # Uses your _variables.yml
)

Troubleshooting

Having trouble? Here are some common hiccups and how to fix them:

  • Q: My styles aren‚Äôt applying!
    A: Make sure your SCSS file is referenced in your YAML header

  • **Q: Where‚Äôs my _variables.yml?**
    A: Run write_variables() in your project directory

Wrap Up

That‚Äôs it! You‚Äôre ready to create beautiful, consistent Quarto projects faster than a frog can catch a fly.

Remember: - Keep your projects organized - Style consistently - Have fun with your analysis!

Need more help? Hop over to our GitHub repository or check out the function documentation.

Check out other goodies that are constantly being developed. For example, explore the new froggeR::load_data() function to recursively load various data file types to the local R environment!

Happy analyzing! üê∏
